title: Ticket #1712: rotate instead of truncating node job user logs?
description: Maybe DAGMan should rotate, instead of truncating, node job user log files when it monitors one for the first time (the real solution would be to add a way to correctly associate events with a given DAGMan instance, so we wouldn't have to remove old events from the logs at all). Anyhow, Pegasus just ran into a situation where we couldn't get some info we needed because the relevant part of a log file was truncated... (Maybe there should be a config knob for whether to do this, and how many old versions to keep.)
